Dear Madison C-3 Families:

We had a successful first week of school and I want to thank all of the parents/guardians in our community for the support as we continue to provide in-person learning to our students. Our staff has been working hard to provide the safest, most sanitary learning environments for our students, and will continue to do so. Please continue to screen your children each day for any symptoms of COVID-19. Also, please take your child’s temperature before bringing or sending them to school each day. Parents should not bring or send an ill student to school.

Again, I want to thank everyone for the cooperation and support throughout the first full week of school; we are all very happy to finally have the students back in the building. Have a great week!

Sincerely,

Dr. Zach Bruner, Superintendent

Dear Madison Families:

The graduation ceremony scheduled for June 26th at 8:00 p.m. will now be held in the gym. The Governor has opened the state up and with the possibility of rain on both the 26th and 28th, we have decided that this is the best way to be sure that we can have graduation as planned. The safety of our students, their families, and our staff is always our number one concern, so we will still limit each graduate to 10 guests and there will be areas marked in the bleachers for each family, to allow for social distancing. Doors will open at 7:00 p.m. and seating in the bleachers will be first come, first serve. We look forward to providing a great ceremony for our graduates.

Sincerely,

Dr. Bruner, Superintendent

Dear Madison C-3 Community,

I have been in meetings all day in which the Randolph and Boone County Health Departments presented information regarding the COVID-19 (Corona) Virus. They have assured all of us not to panic and that they would be continuing to update us on any information that they receive. I plan to continue to stay informed regarding the situation and any pertinent information that is relayed to me will be relayed to staff and community very quickly. For now, please encourage your kid(s) to wash their hands thoroughly and I encourage people to sanitize commonly used areas. I also encourage all adults to practice thorough hand washing practices. As of now, we plan to continue going to school according to the master calendar.

Have a great day!

Sincerely,
Mr. Bruner, Superintendent
